result.execSummary:
The defendant MICHAEL STEVEN CANAN was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Winnebago County Clerk of Circuit Court

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are to be paid directly to the Winnebago County Clerk of Courts within 60 days. Payment plans are available in the Clerk of Courts office. Do NOT pay Probation Agent. Debts older than 90 days will be processed for civil judgment and sent to the Department of Revenue for collection including tax intercept. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. MICHAEL STEVEN CANAN

records.addlTxt: DE's Judgment for unpaid fines, forfeitures and other financial obligations and Notice of Certification - moved, left no address, unable to forward.

9:16 AM  Prosecuting attorney Amanda Nash in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MICHAEL STEVEN CANAN appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Daniel Mark Muza in court for MICHAEL STEVEN CANAN.   Offer:  12 months jail - consecutive with 3 days credit. Uncharged read-in:  Oshkosh Police Report 22-6266.   Sentencing argument for concurrent jail.  Court finds defendant Guilty on Count 1.  Courts orders 1 year prison an 1 year extended supervision - concurrent to any other sentence.  Conditions of extended supervision is:  Costs/Fees due in 60 days.  Failure to pay shall result in civil judgment.  Counseling, absolute sobriety and Pay supervisory fees and follow rules as set by the agent.
Outagamie County Jail - sent to court services for process

3:52 AM Attorney Daniel Mark Muza in court for Defendant MICHAEL STEVEN CANAN. Prosecuting Atty Tucker T. Tellefson appeared for State of Wisconsin. Defendant MICHAEL STEVEN CANAN appeared by video means and in custody.    Information received by Defendant, waives formal reading and enters a not guilty plea.  Bond continues.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:15 am.

08:39 AM Defendant MICHAEL STEVEN CANAN in court (via phone from Outagamie County Jail) with attorney Daniel Mark Muza.  Defendant MICHAEL STEVEN CANAN in custody.  Adam Joseph Levin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bond Continues.  The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.  Record closed @ 8:42.  Arraignment scheduled for April 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
